sentence.Network_en: He showed me the flat he shares with Esther.
sentence.Network_cn: 他带我看了他和埃丝特合住的公寓。

sentence.Network_en: Esther used to visit him for the occasional days and weekends.
sentence.Network_cn: 埃丝特过去会偶尔在周末或别的日子来探望他。

sentence.Network_en: Esther, wielding an iron, pressed out the wrinkles between the flounces.
sentence.Network_cn: 埃斯特使着熨斗, 把荷叶边上的一道道小皱纹熨平.

means.word_mean: 1. (Old Testament) a beautiful Jewess chosen by the king of Persia to be his queen; she stopped a plot to massacre all the Jews in Persia (an event celebrated by Jews as the feast of Purim)
2. an Old Testament book telling of a beautiful Jewess who became queen of Persia and saved her people from massacre
